abstract.text: Create apps that help people better understand and manage their health.

inlineContent.text: CareKit gives users the ability to manage and understand their health. Your apps
can highlight trends, celebrate goals, and create incentives for users. CareKit 2.0
is available for iOS 13/iPadOS 13 and above.
CareKit makes it easy to provide engaging, consistent interfaces with delightful
animations, and full interaction with the accessibility features of iOS and iPadOS.
This open source framework is written entirely in Swift, and it leverages some of
the most powerful Swift language features, such as Combine.
Your CareKit apps can:
Easily digitize a prescription.
Provide meaningful health data and trends to users.
Allow users to connect with their care providers.
The framework provides a powerful set of data models for persistence. Your app’s
user is represented in CareKit’s data as a patient. A patient needs to complete a
set of tasks, like taking a medication or logging their symptoms. Tasks are created
with a schedule, so a patient knows when to perform each task. Schedules are composable,
so you can build a complex set of requirements by combining simple ones.
The combination of a patient’s tasks make up a care plan. A care plan is designed
to help a user improve part of their health, for example, recovering from an operation
or managing diabetes. A patient can have multiple care plans, and each care plan
can have contacts associated to them. Contacts are the patient’s care providers.
When a patient completes a task, the results are stored as outcomes. These outcomes
and their associated values enable you to provide charts and graphs for a user, that
help them understand the health impact of their care plan.

CareKit-1.alt: Screenshots from a CareKit application. The first screenshot shows a week-long calendar, the tasks assigned to the user, and a graph of the users results. The second screenshot shows the CareKit contacts interface, with two contacts displayed.

abstract.text: Create apps that help people better understand and manage their health.
A view controller that displays a calendar in the header, and a page view controller
in the body.
A protocol that manages data changes in a view controller, that handles daily tasks,
and has a synchronized calendar.
The object that handles callbacks when important events occur in a daily page view
controller.
A view controller that displays a calendar page view controller in the header, and
a collection of tasks in the body.
Handles events related to an
A view controller that displays views in a list view.
An object that provides context for a view model value.
Provides synchronization to CareKit view controllers by setting itself as the store
delegate, and then listening in on the store’s activity.
Display calendars to users.
Display charts to users.
Create and customize controls, labels, and views.
Display contacts to users.
Create tasks and schedules for patients and display them using a synchronized view
controller.

abstract.text: Customize the style and appearance of user interface elements.
Display tasks to users.
A protocol that allows you to query and display a custom patient data type.
A protocol that allows you to query and display a custom contact data type.
An object that represents a single occasion on which a task is scheduled to occur.
A protocol that allows you to query and display a custom outcome data type.
A protocol that allows you to query and display a custom patient data type.
A protocol that allows you to query and display a custom task data type.
A task you can version and persist in a database.
An object that represents a set of tasks, that includes interventions and assessments
a patient needs to complete for a specific condition.
An object that represents a contact with which a user may want to get in touch.
An object that represents a single occasion on which a task is scheduled to occur.
A string value that represents the ID of an object in the local database.
An object that provides additional information or context for objects and values.
The result of an event that corresonds to a task.
An object that represents a measurement that a user gives in response to a task.
A protocol that allows you to query and disply a custom underlying outcome value
data type.
A patient object that represents the user of your application.
A compositon of any number of other schedulable objects.
An object that represents a single event that repeats at fixed intervals.
The schedule event for the task occurrence.
A three-component number format for specifying version numbers.
The database where you store all CareKit data.
An object that represents some task or action a patient needs to perform.
